item.description:
Wagon Hill Farm is an 140 acre farm purchased by the town of Durham and open to the public. It provides scenic views of fields, woods, and an estuary bay where salt water and fresh water mix even though the bay is 10 miles in land.  Therefore there are also high and low tides.  There is a swimming area and numerous picnic tables.  We will do a loop hike around the outer perimeter which will be approximately 2 miles or so.  Any one wanting more exercise would walk the loop twice or explore some of the trails inside the loop.  I will probably walk the loop twice, the second time in reverse.  

This hike is more about enjoying the scenery and getting some exercise as opposed to going on a longer hike for more exercise.  We will be doing the hike during low tide.

Please note that the rules state that dogs are supposed to be on leash and there could be a $150 dollar fine if your dog is caught off leash by the police.  A person I met who walks his dogs there every day off leash says he hasn't seen the police that often but they do come around once in a while.  He sticks to the outer trails. I am going to do it off leash but do it at your own risk.

There is limited parking at the trail head for about 20 cars or so.  If enough people want to go we might have to figure out something about car pooling.

Here are a few links describing the farm and the trails:

http://www.seacoastnh.com/Travel/Scenic_Walks/Wagon_Hill_Farm/1/

http://www.hikenewengland.com/WagonHillFarmNH091004.html

http://www.hikenewengland.com/WagonHillFarmNH090511.html

Here is a link to a trail map:

http://www.hikenewengland.com/MapLarge-WagonHillFarmNH091004.html

The woods trail on the other side of the road appeared to be unused and unmaintained.  At least there was no evidence anyone had used it all winter from the lack of foot prints in the snow.

 

I will post some photos in the photo album as previews of the hike.
item.how_to_find_us: Turn in to the driveway at the sign for Wagon Hill Farm and drive up towards the farm house. There is a lower and upper parking lot within sight of each other. Park in either one.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Wagon Hill Farm - Meadows - Woods - Little Bay/ Oyster River Estuary Waterfront
